text: Hello, I'm looking to purchase your beautiful sugar bowl. I've wanted this piece since I was a child; I'm willing to offer 250 in cash.
I'm glad you're interested in my bowl. This is a very high-quality, handmade bowl made in New England in the 17th century. Therefore, I'll gladly sell you this bowl for $450.
Would you like to buy my bowl for $450?

I understand wholeheartedly that you want to get the most money you can get out of it, but the sentimental value of it completes a set I had had as a child. I can't afford anything close to what you are asking at this time; the best I can do is $280. Please consider this as the holidays are around and it would be soo apreciated. Hope to hear from you soon. ||Best Wishes.

Since this is a very popular item and I have many other interested buyers, I'm afraid your offer of $280 is not the highest offer. However, I can offer the bowl to you for $410, which is a very good deal for this exquisite item.

Yes, I understand, it's just the pricing is too much for me to take on at this moment. I have 2 children, and with the holidays approaching their needs have to be met first; my final offer is 300. Please consider my last and final offer. Thank you.
Since I understand that finances are very tight around this time of year, I can offer the bowl to you for $400. Going any lower than that could hurt my reputation as an antiques dealer.
Could we possibly meet in the middle at 350? Again, this is such a stretch for me.

You seem like a very kind person and I can tell that this bowl means a lot to you and your family. Therefore, I will offer it to you for $375. This is certainly not an ideal selling price for me, but I do occasionally make exceptions for loyal customers.
375, done. ||Thank you soo much.
Wonderful! Enjoy your beautiful bowl.
It's greatly appreciated. ||Thank you again.
Thank you!
Hi, I would like to buy the beautiful sugar bowl you have on sale, and I would be more than happy to offer $250 for it.  Thank you.
Not a chance.
Hi, what price are you looking to sell the sugar bowl at?
$375 is more than fair, with the price of silver alone. Makes it a bargain.
I would be willing to offer $350.
I'm firm, so you have the opportunity to confirm the recent price levels of silver.
Okay, I would be willing to pay $375 for the sugar bowl. ||*willing
Thank you, enjoy.
Thank you.
Hello, I am interested in buying the sugar bowl for $250.00, Thanks
Thanks for the bid, but such bowls are finely crafted, centuries-old, and hard to find.  The time and effort to procure them alone makes that an unacceptable underbid.
Would you reconsider to a more mutually  acceptable purchase price?
I appreciate your communication, but with difficulty I will be able to pay you $350.00.
Hello, How are you? I am looking to buy the sugar bowl for $250. :)

Good day! I see you have had a look at that Langlands sugar bowl. He was a very interesting New England silversmith at the time, obviously overshadowed by the bigger names, so a bit more fastidious, and a perfectionist to distinguish himself. He's at present a minor silversmith, but there are quite remarkable points which will put him up with the masters, I assure you.
What say you? Are you appreciating these finer points of Langland's work that override his more populist common celebrities?
Absolutely. ||Thank you for that piece of story. I love it. ||How about $280?

Terrific. Well, you can see right here that this sugar bowl has this ....do you see that blemish? THAT was enough for that Langland to reject it. Whereas look at what it is selling for: over ten thousand dollars because that drunkard who napped after lunch has his name on it...
Mhmm.
It's a steal at $400, I think. I like your enthusiasm.
How about 350?
$370 and its yours.
It IS Christmas after all. ||$370?
Hmm.. alright. ||370 it is.
Yay! Good show! Well done! Allow me to wrap this up for you, and I will tell you a few more things about Langland. He was very short, you know.
Alright. Thank you so much!
I'll take this bowl for 250.
I need 350
The best I can do is 300.
Done.
Great. 300.
I'm willing to purchase the sugar bowl for $250, but that's really all that I can afford at this juncture.
What a good offer.
What a good offer.
Hello, My name is Jack and I'm interested in buying the sugar bowl that you listed. I would be willing to buy it for $250. Please let me know if this works for you. Thanks! Best, Jack

Hello!  Thank you for your interest in the sugar bowl.  As I'm sure you're aware, this sugar bowl is a fine example of high craftsmanship of Langland's make, which sell for up to $800.  Considering the blemish, however, I would like to counter-offer with a price of $600
If you would like to purchase the bowl, please let me know!
Hello! Thank you for your response. I was wondering if you could further describe the blemish on the item. I was also wondering where you originally obtained it.
The blemish is a small smudge on the underside of the bowl in the varnish.  I obtained the bowl itself from a collector.
Would it be possible to do $500?
I would accept $500 for the bowl.
Okay, then I'll take it. Thanks!
Of course! Have a wonderful day!
You as well!
Hi I would really want to buy this piece of antique, and given the info that I have gathered I would want to extend an already generous price of $250 for that sugar bowl
Hi! Thank you for your offer. This is a one-of-a-kind piece, valued at $700. I'd be willing to sell it at a significantly reduced price. I am offering it to you for $500.
What do you think of my offer?
Is there any way we can settle this at around 350-400? ||$500 is a little over.
I'm willing to go down to $450.
Deal.
Great!

Hello! I'm interested in purchasing the sugar bowl that is for sale.  This sugar bowl would complete a tea set that I've had since my childhood and that has immense sentimental value.   I would be interested in a price point of $250, and I would greatly appreciate your cooperation. Thank you

Hi. So glad you are interested. I'd love to sell the bowl to you, though I'm afraid your initial offer is just too low, and won't cover even my initial investment in the piece. I know that it may be too much of a jump for you, but I will consider an offer closer to $500.
Hello.
Hello!  Thanks for the message -  would $400 work for you?
Yes, 400 will work for me.
Ok sounds good!
Great!

Hello there! I'm extremely interested in buying your sugar bowl--it is so beautiful! I've been looking for something similar for a long time, and I'm so happy I've come across this. Unfortunately, I don't have very much extra money right now, but I could offer you $250 for your sugar bowl. What do you think?
So glad you're interested! It's a lovely bowl with intricate designs by a well-known artist from colonial New England. I'm selling it for 500, but maybe we could work something out.
Hi, does this chat work?
Is this the seller of the sugar bowl?
Yes, hi! You're the buyer?
Yes!
Ok, cool.
I'd really love to buy it, but I don't have more than $400 to spend... Is there any way we could work something out?
Yeah, I was going to say, I'm asking 500 but I could go down a bit for you.
Wow, that would be great!
How about 400? Don't want to lose money on it.
Is there any way we could do slightly lower? 400 is basically my upper limit--would you be willing to do $375?
Unfortunately, I've got online buyers who are also interested. Gotta stick with 400! Can you do that?
Alright. It is a beautiful piece and I'd love to add it to my collection, so I'll take it for $400. Thanks so much!
Ok, thank you. It's a great piece, I promise.
Hi! I would love to purchase this sugar bowl! It is really stunning. I can offer you 250 dollars for it. How does that sound?
Hi there!  You sure have a good taste! This bowl dates back to 1750 from England. I can sell it for $399. Is that within your price range?

Wow, from the 1750's? That's incredible. 399 is unfortunately a little high for me. I am looking to buy this piece in order to complete a set that was given to me by very dear family members. Is there any way we could settle for lower? How does $300 sound to you?
Hi there! You sure have good taste! This piece of antique ornament dates back to 1750 from England. I am happy to sell it for $330-$399. Is that within your price range?

330 is getting closer, but again a little high for me. How about 310? I understand that this piece is very valuable, so I want to offer you the best price I can possibly give. ||Buying this piece is really important to me and my family.
This piece would be a lovely addition to your existing collection. It is rather unique and well preserved. I really want to help you out here. Let's see,  I can do $328.
I agree! I really would love to add it. I just don't have that kind of money on hand today though. I couldn't possibly go higher than $315. ||What do you think?
That's too bad.
Really, this piece means a lot to me. ||Couldn't you make an exception?
How's $325? I cannot go lower than that.
If you make it $323 we have a deal.
Really? 2 dollars?
I could go lower... Sir, we are so close to an agreement. ||Have we settled for $323?
I am already making an exception for you here. ||You sound like you really like the bowl.
So am I. I am going well above my price range to purchase this piece, and I do want it. So please help me be able to afford this. ||Fine. $325 is fine. Do we have a deal?
I am already losing money at $325. I really want to help you complete your family set. ||Great. ||$325 it is.
It's settled then. $325.

Hello, I might be interested in the sugar bowl. I do have another one at home so I do not give a lot of value to it. But I might be interested in buying it, just if you confirm its price to be below $250.
Hello, this bowl is rather valuable, and I'd like to sell it for no less than $250.
Hello, this bowl is rather valuable; its market price is somewhere between $400 and $600. I expect to sell it for at least $250.
Hello, it seems we are aligned! $240 and we are done!
Great! Bye!
Thanks, bye!
I'm willing to pay $250 for the sugar bowl. Final offer, take it or leave it.
You're quite the haggler for this beautiful sugarbowl!
Hey there, I'm glad you like the sugar bowl. It's quite a fine piece. ||Hello there.
Hi, there. ||Yes, a fine piece indeed. ||If you're selling, I'd like it for my collection. ||Ideally, I will spend $200, but if need be, $250 is the most I can do.
It is for sale, and I'd be happy to talk with you about pricing, but $250 is lower than I can go. ||I am offering it in the $350 range today.
Ahhhh I'm afraid I can't go lower than $300. ||Let's compromise: $320 and be on our way!
That sounds agreeable to me! I'm glad we could reach an agreement.
Likewise am I. Pleasure doing business with you.
Sure thing! Have a good one.
You too.
Hello, I would like to offer 250 for the sugar bowl.

Dear Buyer, I would consider $500 for the sugar bowl. It's from the late 18th century and shows excellence in Early American silverware craftsmanship. This piece would be a great addition to any collection. Please let me know if you are interested.
Dear Buyer, where you able to look at my proposal?
Hello, what price are you offering?

Dear Buyer, I could offer the silver sugar bowl at $500. The silver bowl is from the 18th century and represents the highest level of silver craftsmanship. This sugar bowl would the centerpiece of any collector's showcase. It was produced by an American silversmith known for his exquisite craft.
Good.
Let's consider it a done deal; I take PayPal or Apple Pay.
I'm willing to pay $250 for the bowl; any higher and there's hardly any benefit in it for me.
Well, the bowl cost me $650, but I am willing to sell it to you for $400. I am flexible, though, so I think we can come up with a compromise.
How does meeting cleanly in the middle sound?
Sounds good to me.  325?
That's perfect.
Great, let's do it.
Any idea how exactly we enter that in? Or is it just the agreement in the chat?
I'm going to raise my hand to see.
Thanks, I appreciate it.
Hi, nice sugar bowl. It caught my eye and it looks like a beautiful piece. How much would you want for it? Maybe $250?
Hi! I'm glad you're interested. It is a special piece. $250 is a loss for me, but if you're about to bump it up a little, to $650, I'd be happy to let it go
I see that you're interested in buying the sugar bowl.
Hi, nice sugar bowl. It caught my eye and it looks like a beautiful piece. How much would you want for it? Maybe $250?
$250 would be selling it at a loss for me! How about $650?
Hmm, well I don't have that much to spend, but I could move up a bit so you're not selling at a loss. How does $350 sound?
How about $450?
That's just a bit too high, would $400 work?
Sure that works.
Awesome, sounds good.
Hi Seller, I am interested in purchasing your sugar bowl. I would be willing to give you $250 dollars for it. Are you willing to sell?
Hi Buyer, that offer is much too low for such a fine sugar bowl. I am willing to sell it for no less than $450.
Hello, buyer! Are you willing to buy the bowl for $450?

Hi seller, unfortunately I cannot spend that much on this bowl. I have seen it offered from other individuals for only $300. However, I am interested in this one. I think we can negotiate a lower price. ||How about $325?
I'd like to counter that with $400.  That's as low as I can go to make a profit.
That is still just a bit too pricey for me. Would you consider $360?
That's too low for me. Thanks for your interest.
Ok, 400 works. ||Good with you?
Yes. Nice doing business.

Hey there. So I'm looking at this beautiful sugar bowl, which I would love to have to complete my set. It's the last piece I need to complete what a dear relative of mine used when we would spend time together and it would mean a lot for me to have it, but I don't have so much to offer. If you'd be willing, I can offer $250 for it. Please let me know!
Hello. Unfortunately I have had interest from buyers at above the price you are asking for this piece. I can offer $450 for the piece.
Hello.
Hi! How's it going?
Great! I am glad to find such an interested buyer; unfortunately, your offer of $250 is well below what I'm able to offer. ||I can offer $450.

I would really like to have this sugar bowl... It's the last thing I can remember of my aunt, but it broke before she died and I've never been able to replace it. Would you be willing to accept something closer to $300?
Unfortunately, that is still below what I'm able to offer. I have had interest from online buyers for this piece above that price. The lowest I can offer is $400. Does that work for you?
As generous as it is of you to lower your price, that is still a bit above my limit. How about... $325?
Sorry! That $400 is truly the lowest I can offer. ||If we can't agree on this price I'm afraid we will not be able to make a deal. ||I could offer $395 actually.
Oh no! I really don't think I'll ever see it again and it would kill me not to get it... $370?
$395 is truly the lowest I can offer.
$380? Please?
I'm sorry...395 is the lowest. ||I'm afraid we have 1 minute left.
Could you accept $390? I hate to still be lower than what you've said is your lowest, but I have a rather strange balance in my bank account.
Do we have a deal for $395? ||I can't go lower.
Ok I suppose. ||$395.
OK! Deal.

Hi, my name is Chandler Brown, and in your collection I have seen that there is a beautiful sugar bowl! I saw what it was priced as, and I wanted to know if we could maybe get the price down to around $250.

Hey there. So, thanks for the interest. I am unfortunately not able to go past 300 dollars, as that is what I paid for it. I am however interested in getting rid of it, without a loss. It's worth more, if you wanna resell it. Besides, 300 will make both of us come out of this without any net loss/gain. What do you say to that?
Really, I mean, we both want our bonuses, but it's pitiful. It would probably be more productive to just agree to the price and get on with our lives. :P ||Hello?
Sorry, it is just that $300 is a little bit of a stretch for me. I really appreciate you giving me that offer, but there has got to be a way where we can get it just a little lower.

Nah, not really. You can also walk away without a bowl and I can find someone else who is willing to pay 300 for it. ||I don't see how it's not a fair deal when I am using logic. It is worth more, meaning you can resell it for someone who has more time than I do. ||It covers what I paid for it. ||No more, no less. ||And in terms of fairness, at that price, none of us would end up with more than the other, at the end of the day.
Ok, I'll settle for 300 then. Is it a deal?
Yep. Deal. ||Pleasure doing business with you.

Greetings, Seller - I hope this message finds you well. You've got a sugar bowl that I've had my eye on for quite some time. In fact, it's a wonderful companion to some additional pieces I own. I would love to discuss the possibility of purchasing. I'm in a position to initially offer  you $250. May I ask what range or price point you're looking for? Best, Buyer

Hello Buyer! Thanks so much for your interest in this lovely sugar bowl!  It is quite lovely and is a piece that would go well with many collections.  It was made by the famous Langlands in the 1750s and is a valuable antique.  Given that it is such a valuable antique, I was hoping to sell it for $600.  Perhaps we can work out a deal! Best,Seller
Hello, Buyer!  How do you feel about a steep $75 discount, pricing the bowl at $525?

Seller, that's really gracious! If there's any additional wiggle room, would you be open to $500? I recognize the value of your piece (and appreciate your willingness to reduce the price so far). I understand if it's prohibitive, but I'd be very, very grateful.
$500 works for me!  I'm glad to know the bowl will be going to an owner who will take care of it. ||I appreciate doing business with you!
Aw, Seller - You've got one heck of a Christmas card comin'. Thank you! I accept! :)
Well, I hope this makes a great Christmas gift for you! :)
What up dude. I'll give you $250 for this sugar bowl.
Hi there! This bowl is a unique piece from the 1800s. Market prices for these things vary around 600 dollars, but I'm willing to give this one to you for two-thirds the price!
Hey! So what do you think about my offer?
Nah bro, I've been doing research on this stuff since I was a child. Definitely not worth $600.
But I'm giving it to you for 400.
It's worth $250.
It will very nicely complement any home.
We can split the difference and say I'll give you $325.
How about 350?
Deal.
Excellent! You'll really enjoy it!
Hello, hope you're having a great day! I am interested in buying this sugar bowl and would like to offer you $250 for it.
I'm hoping to sell it for $575, so we're a ways off from each other. What are you willing to increase your offer to?
Hi! Thanks for getting back to me regarding the sugar bowl. Unfortunately, $575 is more than I can offer. Would you be willing to consider an offer of $400?
Thanks so  much for your interest. That's still a ways off for me. $500?
What about $450? ||The sugar bowl would be completing a set for me, so I can assure you it'd be going to a good home!
It's a deal. :)
Fantastic! $450 it is. Thanks!

Hello, my name is Alison. I am so glad that I decided to come to this antique fair today! I've been feeling under the weather, but thought this could be my lucky day to find this sugar bowl to match a family heirloom tea set. I can offer $250 for it. How does that sound?

Hi Alison, my name is Emily. Thanks so much for stopping by at my booth! This sugar bowl was made in the 1750s by the Langfords, highly skilled and detailed oriented craftsmen. The original value of this bowl is $800, but I'd be willing to sell it to you for $650!
Hi! The value of the bowl is $800, but I'd be willing to sell for less - what do you say $675?

Hi Emily! So great to meet you. Yes, this is the piece I've been looking for! This tea set has been in my family since the early 1900s and is my only memory from my mother's side of the family. ||At some point the sugar bowl went missing so I've been looking for this one piece for the past 20 years.
That's a shame! I'm so glad you were able to find this, Alison.
In my research, the tea set in full is valued at $2000. I'm not sure I can see paying over $350.
The full value of the sugar bowl alone is $800, but as I said, I'd be more than happy to go lower if that means you'll be able to complete your tea set. What do you say to $550?
It would mean the world to me and my family to be able to complete the tea set. It would bring my great grandmother so much joy! She's turning 100 in January, by the way.
That's wonderful! You must buy this sugar bowl for her.

Wow, I'd really love to. It has taken me so long to find this piece. How does $400 sound? There seems to be a bit of wear and tear to the piece and again, the entire set is not valued at more than $2000. ||The market looks to be closing soon. Do we have a deal at $400?
I think you'd be hard pressed to find a perfect piece, that still remains so finely detailed. The lowest I'd be willing to drop to is $450.
$425 and let's make it happen!
Deal.
Great.
Hi, I'm interested in the sugar bowl, but I see it has defects so I am only going to offer $250. This is my final offer. It's really not worth that much.

Hi, thank you for your response. This bowl is worth a lot more than that; I bought it at $800 because it is a 1750 relic from a skilled potter. However, I know that there is a defect on it, so I can lower the price to $500. How does that sound?
Hi, how are you feeling about the sugar bowl?

Well, I'm glad you realize it isn't in perfect condition and are willing to come down in price. However, $500 is totally unrealistic. I can offer you $280 tops, which is really too much. Take it or leave it.
I'm sorry, it is worth a lot more than $280 both in antique and artistic value. I can consider $450 if you're open to that.
If you are an experienced antiques dealer, you will be very happy to sell this item at this price. You may not get another sale this good all day. ||I am firm at $280. This is very generous.
I am experienced enough to know that this is worth quite more than sub-$300. $450 is quite a good deal.
If you're thinking $300, I suppose I can go up by $20. Just being kind since it's the holidays and I don't want your family to starve.
How about $420 since I do think you could be deserving of this bowl?
Nice try, but we are still $120 apart. Make me a better offer.
$400 then. I can't afford to decrease price any more for its value.
Let's split the difference. $350 is my final offer. I don't have all day, so please decide right now.
Alright, let's do it.
Thank you! It's a deal. Happy holidays!
Hi there! Hope this finds you well. I'm interested in sugar bowl you're selling. I'd like to make an offer of $250.  Looking forward to hearing back from you!

Hi! Thanks for your interest in the bowl. As you know it's an antique piece made in New England in the 1750's and its value is much more than the price you are asking for. I can't go under 400. I hope that you will consider my offer. Thanks
Hello! I hope you found my message and are considering my offer.
Hi there! Yes. I completely understand, but as a last plea, is there any way you could let it go for 350? ||there* ||I hope my grammar mistake doesn't influence your decision, lol.
I could lower symbolically to 390, but can't go under that price or I will be losing money!
Understood. I'll take it at 390. ||Thank you!
Great, it was a pleasure to do business with you and I hope you will enjoy this beautiful piece. Have a great day.
Right back atcha!
Hello, I'm offering $250 for the sugar bowl. I don't want to go over this price.
Since the bowl is from the 1700s and very special, I will not consider a price under $300. Is there any way that you can offer a higher price?
You make some good points. What about $275?
Since the bowl is from the 1700s and quite special, is there any way that you can increase your offer?
That's better, but I originally planned to sell it for $350. I lowered it since I think you would appreciate a beautiful piece. I'm still asking $300.
Okay, that's fair. $300 it is. Will you take this offer?
Your're getting closer! :) If you miss a cup of Starbuck's coffee, the sugar bowl is yours! ||Yes I will. Thanks!
Awesome! Glad things worked out.
I'm looking to purchase a sugar bowl in the ballpark of $250. Not interested in paying much more.
I am willing to sell for 350; no less. Have to make a profit.
I'll pay $350.
I am willing to accept 350, but no less than that; I have to make a profit.
Alright. $350 it is.
Good morning. I'm interested in buying your sugar bowl on display. I'm willing to give you 250 cash  right now. Sound like a deal?
Your offer is way too low. It is rare and I really need to get at least $400.
Simply can't afford that much, but I would really like to purchase the piece from you. Would you be willing to accept $325?
Your offer is understandable, but I need to get to the break-even amount.  How about $370?
370 sounds fair.
Do we have a deal for $370?
We've got a deal.
Great! Wonderful negotiating with you. You are one of the fairer customers out there. I hope you enjoy the bowl for many years to come. Thanks.
Have a great one as well; it's a piece for my mother, so it means a lot to me to be able to find it for her birthday.

Hello! I hope you are having a wonderful day. I am interested in possibly purchasing the bowl in your possession. Is it possible to get it for $250? Thank you for the time you spent reading this message.

The market value is estimated to be near $1,000 for this hand crafted pure silver bowl, made here in New England long ago.  I would not be able to sell for only $250; I could consider a value closer to $800?
Hello there!
Hello! How are you doing?
Not too bad, weather is chilling lately.  How are you feeling today?
Good! The weather is very chilly indeed.
So, I understand you may be interested in the silver sugar bowl . . . Have you plans for in-home use, or is there a business use in mind?
I have a question! Currently home use. My grandmother had instilled in me a love of these sort of things. She and I would love for this bowl to be a part of our home.
Are you alright?
I wrote the first part of my response by accident. But I do have a question. Are there any other buyers interested in the bowl?
It would be lovely in your home and contribute a great deal to those special ocassions! ||We have a significant amount of interest in the silver bowl but we can make a deal immediately.
I do agree that this bowl would be a lovely part of our home. I want to know what you mean by closer to 800? Is there a particular range I should be aware of?
Were the bowl merely melted down to pure silver, its value would likely be in the neighborhood of $500. ||Much labor was invested to make it!
I assume that the bowl has been used since you had it correct?
I acquired the bowl primarily for presentation and resale rather than use.  It is in almost perfect condition and very old! ||We only have seconds!
OK! Sold.
Hello! I noticed that you have this sugar bowl on sale, and I'm interested in purchasing it. I'd be happy to offer $250 for it. It's really lovely!
This bowl is made by a well-known person. Its original price is $1200. However, I am willing to sell it to you at $350.

I'm very familiar with the item, actually, and I'm a fan of the maker's work. I have some similar items already, and this would be a great addition to my collection, most of which was a gift from my grandmother. I'm afraid I only have $250 with me right now. Is there any way you could reconsider?
This is a very good price for that bowl.
I agree, and I can tell you are very fair based on the way you've priced your other items. I would be willing to go up to $300, so we meet in the middle?
$350 is the minimum I can sell without losing its break-even price.

I've seen similar items for less in other locations, though I will admit they are not as nice as this one. Can I ask how long you've had this one? ||I'd love to walk out of here with this sugar bowl and with you having $300 more than you do now... haha. :)
1 year, I can come down to $300.
That's wonderful! I'm so thrilled. Thank you very much!
The maxiumn  I will pay for this  sugar bowl is $250

Hello! Thanks for your offer. $250 is very low and much lower than what I purchased it for. I won't be able to accept that price. The highest this bowl went for was $800 recently. The average is about $700. I'd be willing to accept that today. It is a rare  bowl from the 17th century and a rare find!
Hi! Did you receive my message? We have to continue to chat here!
The maximum I  am willing to pay is $250.
Hi! Then we don't have a deal. I wouldn't be able to sell at a loss. Sorry.
I have seen this bowl advertised on selling sites. This is the average price for this item. ||Respond back.

The price online that I am aware of is much higher than $250, but also you don't know the quality and authenticity. Here you are able to touch it, see it, examine in and that is a huge difference maker. The bowls sell for $700 average at open markets; like I said, $800 is the max one sold for. So I would accept in that range. ||If you can do $600, that is the biggest discount I am willing to give. Please let me know.
I saw this item on eBay for $250 dollars... and there where no bids. I will only buy for $250. .....No deal on 600.
$550? Absolute final. ||I am countering but you are not, so that makes it impossible to negotiate.
I will only buy for $250. My final offer.
Ok, then we have no deal. I will close the negotiation.
You are not taking into account what the real price is on eBay. and there were no buyers. 250 firm.
I closed the negotiation as we have no deal. Please do too.
Good morning I hope you are having a nice day so far. I am interested in buying the beautiful silver sugar bowl that you are offering for $250.

Hello! Thank you so much for expressing interest in this fabulous antique sugar bowl! I'm very excited to share the story behind it with you. As it is a genuine antique, I'm afraid that $250 may not be sufficient. Would you mind offering a bit more?
Hello!
